body_html:
Results with curl. First, for reference, I test a file which works, on 3 different machines (machines A, B, C):

curl http://ftp.exim.org/pub/pcre/pcre-8.39.tar.gz | sha256sum

File hash checks out on all machines. Next, on the Python 2.7 license file, from the bazel mirror:

curl https://mirror.bazel.build/docs.python.org/2.7/_sources/license.txt | sha256sum

On machines A and B, this fails with:

curl: (60) SSL certificate problem: unable to get local issuer certificate

On machine C, this works. Machine C did not have any problems building Tensorflow - no workaround was needed.

On all 3 machines, I was able to download this file using wget:

wget https://mirror.bazel.build/docs.python.org/2.7/_sources/license.txt

So, it would seem that curl is more discriminating than wget, somehow, when it comes to checking certificates. That explains part of what has been puzzling me: why is it that I can download the problematical files with no problem, while bazel can't. It seems it is because I use wget, while bazel uses curl.
